artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Masudaya Ginjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 198; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 297.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: soldiers in predominately red and purple tunics and blue pants, with rifles, at left; two fallen men with bugles; man at center in red tunic with blue sleeves aiming rifle at jumping man with spear in red and blue at right; grey and blue smoke clouds
dimension: 14 1/2 × 10 in. (36.83 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal R: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Censor seals R, C: 卯七改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: The Great Battle of the Ane River in the Chronicle of the Great Peace
